questions.prompt: What department is Creed in at Dunder Mifflin?
questions.explanation: Creed Bratton is Quality Assurance.

questions.prompt: Creed’s ‘blog’ was actually what?
questions.explanation: Ryan set up a Word doc and told Creed it was a blog.

questions.prompt: Which instrument does Creed play?
questions.explanation: Both character and actor play guitar.

questions.prompt: Which real band was Creed (the actor) a member of?
questions.explanation: Creed Bratton was a member of The Grass Roots.

questions.prompt: Around Halloween, Creed shows up with what changed?
questions.explanation: He appears suddenly with dyed black hair.

questions.prompt: What company do they work for?
questions.explanation: The Scranton branch of Dunder Mifflin.

questions.prompt: Who is the Scranton branch regional manager for most of the early series?
questions.explanation: Michael Scott leads the Scranton branch.

questions.prompt: Jim and Pam get married at which famous location?
questions.explanation: They elope on the Maid of the Mist at Niagara Falls.

questions.prompt: Dwight owns which kind of farm?
questions.explanation: Schrute Farms is a beet farm and B&B.

questions.prompt: Angela’s beloved cat that met an unfortunate end was named…
questions.explanation: Sprinkles; later Bandit is often seen in the office.

questions.prompt: Kevin is most famously associated with what mishap?
questions.explanation: Kevin’s famous chili spill.

questions.prompt: Stanley’s favorite office day is…
questions.explanation: ‘I wake up every day in a bed that’s too small…’ Pretzel Day.

questions.prompt: Phyllis is married to whom?
questions.explanation: Bob Vance of Vance Refrigeration.

questions.prompt: Ryan started at Scranton as what role?
questions.explanation: Ryan Howard begins as a temp.

questions.prompt: Toby works in which department?
questions.explanation: Toby is the HR rep (corporate HR).

questions.prompt: Andy often performs with which collegiate group name?
questions.explanation: Andy’s a cappella group is ‘Here Comes Treble’.

questions.prompt: Jan later starts which side business?
questions.explanation: ‘Serenity by Jan’ candles.

questions.prompt: Michael briefly starts a rival company called…
questions.explanation: He starts it with Pam and Ryan.

questions.prompt: Which company acquires Dunder Mifflin mid-series?
questions.explanation: Sabre, led by Jo Bennett.

questions.prompt: Robert California becomes what at Sabre?
questions.explanation: He talks himself into the CEO role.

questions.prompt: Dwight’s emergency drill causes which coworker to have a health scare?
questions.explanation: Stanley has a cardiac episode after Dwight’s drill.

questions.prompt: Meredith is hit by whose car?
questions.explanation: Michael hits Meredith, leading to the ‘Fun Run’.

questions.prompt: The ‘Fun Run’ is ostensibly for awareness of which disease?
questions.explanation: The over-the-top Rabies Awareness fun run.

questions.prompt: What is the Scranton branch’s long-time rival branch that merged earlier?
questions.explanation: Stamford merges into Scranton after closures.

questions.prompt: Holly Flax works in which department?
questions.explanation: Holly is HR and Michael’s love interest.

questions.prompt: Creed serves briefly as what at the Scranton branch?
questions.explanation: Creed is acting manager for a short period.

questions.prompt: Jim briefly shares which title with Michael?
questions.explanation: Jim is co‑manager for a period.

questions.prompt: Pam transitions from receptionist to which role?
questions.explanation: Pam later moves to sales (and office admin).

questions.prompt: Who is the CFO that often appears in corporate scenes?
questions.explanation: David Wallace is CFO and later buys the company.

questions.prompt: Which character is known for martial arts and strict rules?
questions.explanation: Dwight has a disciplined, paramilitary vibe.

questions.prompt: Andy plays which string instrument most often?
questions.explanation: Andy frequently plays banjo.

questions.prompt: Michael dates his realtor named…
questions.explanation: Carol (played by Steve Carell’s real-life spouse).

questions.prompt: Kelly Kapoor primarily works in…
questions.explanation: Kelly is Customer Service.

questions.prompt: Oscar’s department is…
questions.explanation: Oscar is part of accounting.

questions.prompt: Darryl starts in the warehouse and later moves…
questions.explanation: He transitions to an office position.

questions.prompt: The office is located in which city?
questions.explanation: Scranton, Pennsylvania.

questions.prompt: What’s the name of the local paper company visited by Michael and Dwight that is family-run?
questions.explanation: Prince Family Paper episode.

questions.prompt: Which character starts ‘WUPHF.com’?
questions.explanation: Ryan’s multi‑platform notification startup.

questions.prompt: Gabe Lewis is introduced after which corporate change?
questions.explanation: Gabe is a Sabre liaison.

questions.prompt: Nellie Bertram is associated with which position at various times?
questions.explanation: Nellie pops in as a manager/special projects.

questions.prompt: Which couple calls off their wedding before Pam & Jim’s storyline?
questions.explanation: Pam and Roy split before Pam & Jim marry.

questions.prompt: Creed is known for what kind of personal backstory style?
questions.explanation: He hints at criminal or odd past experiences.

questions.prompt: Which branch does Karen Filippelli transfer to before returning later in the series?
questions.explanation: Karen becomes the Utica branch manager.

questions.prompt: Whose baby is named ‘Cece’?
questions.explanation: Cece Halpert.

questions.prompt: Which character is a volunteer sheriff’s deputy?
questions.explanation: Dwight cites volunteer deputy/safety roles.

questions.prompt: Michael’s screenplay is titled…
questions.explanation: Threat Level Midnight featuring Michael Scarn.

questions.prompt: Which character’s mom dates Michael briefly?
questions.explanation: Pam’s mom, Helene.

questions.prompt: What annual beach event features competitions among employees?
questions.explanation: Beach Day with sumo suits and contests.

questions.prompt: Who famously says they’re ‘not superstitious, but a little stitious’?
questions.explanation: A classic Michael Scott line.

questions.prompt: Which character runs a bed-and-breakfast at their farm?
questions.explanation: Schrute Farms B&B.
